project.name: Senior SDET Interview Preparation - 8-Week Learning Plan
project.description: Comprehensive learning plan with 364 acceptance criteria across 8 categories for senior SDET interview preparation

features.description: Explain the difference between JDK, JRE, and JVM with real-world examples
steps: Research and understand JDK (Java Development Kit) components
Research and understand JRE (Java Runtime Environment) components
Research and understand JVM (Java Virtual Machine) architecture
Provide real-world examples from test automation context

features.description: Demonstrate understanding of all 4 access modifiers (public, private, protected, default) with code examples
steps: Explain public access modifier with examples
Explain private access modifier with examples
Explain protected access modifier with examples
Explain default (package-private) access modifier with examples
Create comparison table showing visibility scope

features.description: Write code demonstrating the difference between == and .equals() for String comparison
steps: Explain == operator behavior for String comparison
Explain .equals() method behavior for String comparison
Create code examples showing memory reference comparison

features.description: Explain String immutability and its importance in test automation with 2 practical examples
steps: Demonstrate why Strings are immutable in Java
Provide practical test automation example 1: Thread safety
Provide practical test automation example 2: Security

features.description: Create comparison table for String, StringBuilder, and StringBuffer with performance benchmarks
steps: Create detailed comparison table for String, StringBuilder, StringBuffer

features.description: Write code examples for checked vs unchecked exceptions with test automation scenarios
steps: Create test automation example with checked exception (IOException)
Create test automation example with unchecked exception (NullPointerException)

features.description: Explain and code examples for final, finally, and finalize keywords
Implement working examples of all 4 OOP pillars: Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, Abstraction
steps: Explain how they relate to automation

features.description: Create Page Object Model classes demonstrating encapsulation principles
steps: Show how this protects page state
Implement a sample Login Page class

features.description: Explain and code method overloading vs method overriding with 3 examples each
Design and implement abstract class for BasePage in test framework
steps: Identify common page actions (click, type, wait)
Extend BasePage in specific page classes

features.description: Create interface examples for test data providers and explain interface vs abstract class
steps: Implement Interface in ExcelDataProvider and JsonDataProvider

features.description: Demonstrate IS-A and HAS-A relationships using test framework components
steps: Code a test class demonstrating both

features.description: Explain compile-time vs runtime polymorphism with framework examples
steps: Provide WebDriver example (WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver())

features.description: Build a simple test utility showcasing inheritance hierarchy
steps: Create child test classes extending BaseTest

features.description: Explain difference between Collection and Collections with examples
steps: Create code example using Collection interface
Create code example using Collections helper methods (sort, reverse)

features.description: Implement and compare ArrayList, LinkedList, HashSet, TreeSet with performance analysis
steps: Implement ArrayList and explain use cases
Implement LinkedList and explain use cases
Implement HashSet and explain use cases
Implement TreeSet and explain use cases
Compare performance for add, remove, search

features.description: Demonstrate HashMap vs Hashtable vs ConcurrentHashMap with thread-safety scenarios
Create test data management utility using appropriate collection types
steps: Design data structure for test data
Use Map<String, String> for key-value pairs
Use List<Map<String, String>> for data tables
Implement utility methods to access data

features.description: Write code for common collection operations: filtering, sorting, mapping, reducing
Implement custom comparator for test data sorting
steps: Sort a list of objects using the comparator

features.description: Build utility methods for reading test data from Excel/JSON into collections
steps: Simulate reading from Excel to List<Map>
Simulate reading from JSON to Map
Create helper method to fetch data by key

features.description: Explain checked vs unchecked exceptions with 5 practical test automation examples
steps: Categorize them as checked or unchecked
Provide code snippet for handling each

features.description: Implement custom exceptions for framework (e.g., ElementNotFoundException, TestDataException)
steps: Throw these exceptions in framework code

features.description: Write proper try-catch-finally blocks for WebDriver operations
steps: Use finally for cleanup (e.g., taking screenshot on failure)

features.description: Explain difference between throw and throws keywords with examples
Implement ThreadLocal for WebDriver instances for parallel execution
steps: Explain why ThreadLocal is needed for parallel testing

features.description: Demonstrate thread safety using synchronized blocks and methods
Explain and code wait(), notify(), and notifyAll() for thread coordination
Build thread-safe Singleton pattern for WebDriver manager
steps: Implement getInstance method with double-checked locking

features.description: Implement ExecutorService for parallel test execution
steps: Create a pool of threads using Executors

features.description: Manage browser windows: maximize, minimize, set size, get position

Explain Selenium Grid 4 architecture (Hub, Node, Router, Distributor, Session Map)
Set up Selenium Grid using standalone, hub-node configurations
Configure RemoteWebDriver to execute tests on Grid
Implement parallel execution using TestNG thread-count and parallel attributes
Configure cross-browser testing matrix (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari)
Implement ThreadLocal for thread-safe WebDriver instances
Monitor Grid console and troubleshoot common issues
Explain difference between Selenium Grid 3 vs Grid 4
Implement relative locators (above, below, toLeftOf, toRightOf, near)
steps: Create test case using all relative locators
Demonstrate use case for complex tables

features.description: Use new Window and Tab management APIs (newWindow())
Capture element screenshots using getScreenshotAs()

features.description: Utilize Chrome DevTools Protocol integration
Understand Selenium Manager for automatic driver management
Explain architectural differences between Selenium 3 and 4
steps: Explain removal of JSON Wire Protocol

features.description: Demonstrate improved W3C WebDriver protocol compliance
Choose a complex website (e-commerce or SaaS application)
Implement complete Page Object Model structure with 10+ page classes
Use all locator strategies appropriately across pages
steps: Ensure ID is used where available

features.description: Implement proper synchronization throughout
Create utilities package (WaitHelper, JavaScriptHelper, FileHelper)
Handle at least 5 different complex scenarios (file upload, multi-window, drag-drop)
Add proper logging using Log4j2
Include at least 20 test cases covering critical user journeys
Push code to GitHub with proper README and documentation
Explain TestNG advantages over JUnit with 5 key differentiators
steps: Research key differences between TestNG and JUnit frameworks
Create a comparison table highlighting features like grouping, dependency, and parallel execution
Explain why TestNG is often preferred for Selenium automation
Document at least 5 specific features unique to TestNG

features.description: Demonstrate all TestNG annotations with execution order
steps: Add print statements to each annotated method to track execution
Run the class and analyze the console output to understand the hierarchy
Document the execution order for future reference

features.description: Configure test suite using testng.xml with multiple test tags
steps: Create a `testng.xml` file in the project root
Include specific test classes within the xml configuration
Run the suite and verify all specified tests execute

features.description: Implement test grouping using groups attribute
steps: Annotate several test methods with groups="smoke" and groups="regression"
Configure `testng.xml` to include only the "smoke" group
Run the suite and verify that only smoke tests are executed
Verify that regression tests are skipped

features.description: Set test priorities using priority attribute
steps: Create methods with priority=1, priority=2, and priority=3
Create a method without priority to see default behavior
Run the class and verify execution order respects priority over alphabetical order

features.description: Configure test inclusion/exclusion at suite and test level
steps: Exclude a specific test method that is known to fail
Run the suite and confirm the excluded test did not run

features.description: Implement test dependencies using dependsOnMethods and dependsOnGroups
steps: Create a parent test method (e.g., login)
Create a dependent test method (e.g., checkDashboard) using dependsOnMethods
Verify that the dependent test is skipped automatically

features.description: Create multiple testng.xml files for different test suites (smoke, sanity, regression)
steps: Execute each xml file separately to ensure isolation
Explain the benefit of having separate execution files

features.description: Implement parameterization using @Parameters annotation from testng.xml
steps: Update test method signature to accept these parameters using @Parameters
Run the test and verify it uses values from the XML file

features.description: Create data-driven tests using @DataProvider with 5 different examples
steps: Create a method annotated with @DataProvider returning Object[][]
Define 5 sets of test data (e.g., username/password pairs)
Link the test method to the DataProvider
Run the test and verify it executes 5 times with different data

features.description: Configure parallel execution at suite, test, class, and method levels
steps: Run and verify that tests are running on different threads simultaneously

features.description: Calculate and explain thread-count, parallel mode combinations
steps: Research optimal thread counts based on CPU cores
Experiment with different thread counts and measure execution time
Document the relationship between thread count and test stability

features.description: Implement Soft Assertions vs Hard Assertions with use cases
steps: Write a test using standard `Assert.assertEquals` (Hard Assert) and observe immediate failure
Call `softAssert.assertAll()` at the end and explain why it is necessary

features.description: List and demonstrate 10 common TestNG assertions
steps: Document use cases for each assertion type

features.description: Create custom listeners implementing ITestListener, IRetryAnalyzer
steps: Verify the listener triggers when a test fails

features.description: Implement retry logic for failed tests
steps: Apply the analyzer to a flaky test via annotation or listener
Verify the test retries 3 times before finally failing

features.description: Generate TestNG HTML reports and customize report content
steps: Analyze the report content for execution details

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation
features.description: Create Singleton pattern for WebDriver manager

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation
features.description: Design and build Data-Driven Testing framework
steps: Separate test logic from test data
Store data in external files (Excel, JSON)

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation
features.description: Create Strategy pattern for different test execution strategies
steps: Pass the strategy to the test method context

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation

steps: Identify a complex workflow (e.g., User Registration flow involving 3 pages)
Create a Facade class that wraps this workflow

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation
features.description: Build Observer pattern for test event notifications
steps: Implement listeners to observe test events (start, failure, success)
Trigger actions like logging or screenshots when events occur

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation
features.description: Create modular framework architecture with clear separation of concerns
steps: Ensure no cyclic dependencies between packages

features.story: Story 3.3: Design Patterns for Test Automation
features.description: Explain when to use each design pattern with real-world scenarios
steps: Document the pros and cons of POM vs Singleton

features.description: Design framework folder structure following best practices

features.description: Implement configuration management using properties files and config readers

features.description: Create centralized utility packages (waits, alerts, actions, database)

features.description: Build test data management layer with Excel, JSON, CSV readers

features.description: Implement environment-specific configuration (DEV, QA, STAGING, PROD)

features.description: Design abstraction layers separating test logic from implementation

features.description: Implement dependency injection for better testability

features.description: Create framework documentation with architecture diagrams

features.description: Explain scalability, maintainability, and reusability principles

features.description: Integrate Log4j2 for application logging with proper configuration

features.description: Implement ExtentReports for detailed HTML reporting

features.description: Create custom report with test execution summary, pass/fail counts

features.description: Integrate Allure reporting framework

features.description: Configure reports to show execution time, trends, historical data
